Book Description
================
One rainy morning in 1871 in lower Manhattan, Martin Pemberton, a freelance 
writer sees in a passing stagecoach several elderly men, one of whom 
he recognizes as his supposedly dead and buried father. While trying 
to unravel the mystery, Pemberton disappears, sending McIlvaine, his 
employer, the editor of an evening paper, in pursuit of the truth behind 
his freelancer's fate. Layer by layer, McIlvaine reveals a modern metropolis 
surging with primordial urges and sins, where the Tweed Ring operates 
the city for its own profit and a conspicuously self-satisfied nouveau-riche 
ignores the poverty and squalor that surrounds them.

In E. L. Doctorow's skilled hands, The Waterworks becomes, in the words 
of The New York Times, "a dark moral tale . . . an eloquently troubling 
evocation of our past."
